text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon
and today we are making a super easy two ingredient
chocolate mousse.

And you will not believe how simple this is
to make.

The first thing you will need is some chocolate
of course.
I am using some dark, milk and white.

And then to each one of those we are going
to add some hot water.

I'll put the exact amounts of water that you
need for each type of chocolate on the Howtocookthat.net
website for you.

Microwave that for 30 seconds and then stir
and and you'll see it is not quite smooth
but we do need to stir it in the middle here.

And then microwave it for another 20 seconds
stir it again and you can see now that it
is all melted and smooth.

Do the same thing with your milk chocolate
and your dark chocolate you can use just one

type of chocolate if you don't want to layer
it.

But do make sure that you using good quality
chocolate that contains cocoa butter.

Just check your ingredients if it says it
has vegetable fat in it then it no going to
taste as good.

Pour each on into a seperate plastic bag,
seal it up and flatten it out like this.

Then you want to place each of those flat
like that in the freezer for about and hour.

Take it out of the freezer rip open the bag
and place the cold mixture into a bowl and
whip it on high speed until it is smooth.

Then add in the chilled water a little at
a time and whip it on high speed each time
until it is the consistency of a thick cream.

Pour that into a piping bag or a plastic bag
with the corner cut off and then pipe that
into glasses.

gently tap the g;asses on the counter just
to flatten out the edges and the top.

And then pace that in the fridge while you
do the next one.

Grab your bag of milk chocolate and whip it
with the beaters, add int eh cold water and

whisk it in and this milk chocolate one is
my favourite one.

If you are only going to make one make this
one.

Pipe it over the top of the dark one and then
chill it in the fridge again.

This recipe is inspired by one from a french
chemist Dr Herve This but after experimenting
with it I've changed the method completely.

In his one you hand whisk the mixture over
a bowl of iced water for about ten minutes.

And the result is never as fluffy or as smooth
as making it this way.

And this way you don't have to stand there
for ten minutes hand whisking.
So it is a lot easier.

Leave the dessert in the fridge for about
30 minutes and it is ready to serve.
I told you it was super simple.

And because it is just water and chocolate
it tastes of, well pure chocolate.
Share this video with someone who loves chocolate.

Subscribe to How TO Cook That for more cakes
chocolate and desserts, click here for the

website to get the recipe and here for more
of my videos on youtube.
Have a great week and I'll see you on Friday.

[the boat song by youtube.com/setsailtv used
with permission]
